metadata.title: Erowid Oxycodone Vault : Timeline
metadata.description: A timeline of events in the history of Oxycodone

content:
Drug: Oxycodone | cid: 5284603
Source: erowid | Source description: A timeline of events in the history of Oxycodone
Erowid name: oxycodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: History

                    Text: 
                    Oxycodone

Timeline

by Erowid

1916 Oxycodone was first synthesized in Germany as a semi-synthetic derivative of thebaine. 1 1917 Oxycodone is first introduced into clinical practice in Germany under the brand name Eukodal. 2 , 3 1920s Reports first surface of Oxycodone causing "euphoric highs" in patients. [More Info] 1950 Percodan (oxycodone and aspirin combo) is first launched by Endo Pharmaceutical. [More Info] 1960 The United Nation Office on Drug and Crime includes oxycodone in the Dangerous Drugs (Amendment) Ordinance. 1971 Percocet (oxycodone and acetaminophen combo) is first launched by Endo Pharmaceutical. [More Info] 1995 The FDA approves a higher-dose time-release form of Oxycodone under the brand name OxyContin, owned by Purdue Pharma. 1996 OxyContin becomes publicly available.  Recreational use and abuse of oxycodone increases. 2001 OxyContin faces significant national media attention in the U.S. because of increases in recreational use and abuse.

References


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides a detailed timeline of oxycodone's synthesis, medical introduction, and regulatory history from 1916 to 2001, sourced from Erowid. It is relevant for understanding the historical development, medical use, and abuse trends of oxycodone within the broader context of drugs and pharmaceuticals covered in the full webpage. The references included support key historical milestones.
